results.content: Having worked through tutorials on youtube, coursera, edx and udemy over a span of 2 years. I wholeheartedly recommend this Javascript course to anyone aiming to learn the language. I've also taken brad traversy's courses and i think he's great but I prefer John's course as he continuously explains his reasoning throughout the course. I've only asked John 2 questions and he responded the same day despite our huge time difference! Class Act! If you have no experience take your time with this course, go at a slower pace by completing some projects twice or three times before moving on to the next. You'll spend less time confused going back and forth trying to figure out what went wrong and instead your confidence will grow nurturing your journey into development.

results.content: I am a WordPress developer for over a 3 years now. At the beginning of this year I decided that I would like to improve my Frontend skills. So after buying couple courses from different teachers on Udemy, accedently I found John. How? Well, thanks to the codecademy and publishing John's video with Vanilla JS projects. That's the first time I heard of him and I really liked the style of teaching. Easy to understand and repetetive all a long the course. Thank you, John!

results.content: Excelente curso! 100% recomendado. No sólo enseña la sintáxis sino que la ejemplifica y te ayuda a generar un pensamiento para buscar y experimentar más cosas por tu cuenta. Por ejemplo en el caso de los Strings y Arrays Objects, hay muchas cosas que uno puede ir practicando y poniendo a prueba sólo desde la consola. A mi me sirvió para crear un mini-código que analiza una serie de párrafos y arroja resultados del tipo "numero de palabras", "número de caracteres", "número de párrafos", etc... Algo que no había logrado en otros cursos que he tomado por internet. Ahora siento que puedo "hacer cosas" con Javascript más que "memorizar" el lenguaje. En lo personal, siento que el curso me ha ayudado a elaborar cierto modo de pensar. Para quienes no sepan programar como yo lo recomiendo sin dudas. Hay muchísimos ejemplos y uno puedo aprender de ellos muchas cosas.
results.content_html: Excelente curso! 100% recomendado. No sólo enseña la sintáxis sino que la ejemplifica y te ayuda a generar un pensamiento para buscar y experimentar más cosas por tu cuenta. Por ejemplo en el caso de los Strings y Arrays Objects, hay muchas cosas que uno puede ir practicando y poniendo a prueba sólo desde la consola. A mi me sirvió para crear un mini-código que analiza una serie de párrafos y arroja resultados del tipo "numero de palabras", "número de caracteres", "número de párrafos", etc... Algo que no había logrado en otros cursos que he tomado por internet. Ahora siento que puedo "hacer cosas" con Javascript más que "memorizar" el lenguaje. En lo personal, siento que el curso me ha ayudado a elaborar cierto modo de pensar. Para quienes no sepan programar como yo lo recomiendo sin dudas. Hay muchísimos ejemplos y uno puedo aprender de ellos muchas cosas.

Course material and project based approach is amazingly helpful.

I had to learn javascript fast for node and react, so  I stumbled upon one of John's videos on another video platform. I decided to buy the whole course, money well spent.

Just don't binge the course like I do within few days, take it slow if you have the time. John is experienced about which parts you might have difficulty understanding.

And when the previous video just nearly knocked you out, he says "not bad, not bad!" and you decide to keep watching the course. Helps a lot considering the 40 hour time span.

Definitely recommended.

In fact, the best thing is here, John illustrates every single thing and he could understand that a new student easily might be frightened because of something complex. So, he usually changes his tone and tries his best to make us more confident. I really appreciate his great efforts towards us and now I've realized that English or Bengali, language is nothing as long as you have an effective teaching method for everyone. Thanks, John for your effort.
